specials.name: Drain Soul
specials.description:
Similar to the more common wraith's drain life ability but more potent.  When the wraith damages a living creature with its spectral hand Strike, the wraith gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 27 Fortitude save
Failure Drained 2
Success Drained 1
Critical Success No effect.
 Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 2 on a failed save to a maximum of drained 4.  A creature that reaches drained 4 will then become doomed 1 on each further strike for which they fail a save.  A creature that dies from the doomed effect rises as a wraith (as below).

specials.name: Wraith Spawn
specials.description: A living humanoid slain by a wraith’s spectral hand Strike or spectral shroud rises as a wraith spawn after 1d4 rounds. This wraith spawn is under the command of the wraith that killed it. It doesn’t have drain life or wraith spawn and becomes clumsy 2 for as long as it is a wraith spawn. If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will, gains Wraith Spawn, and is no longer clumsy.

specials.name: Spectral Shroud
specials.description:
15 ft.  Bands of dark energy swirl outward from the dread wraith.  Although the storm like waves have no physical effect on the world they tear at the souls of the living.  All living creatures within the aura must make a Fort Save DC 27.  
Critical Failure Drained 1 and Restrained (until successful save or leaving area)
Failure Drained 1 and Stunned 1 (until save or leaving area)
Success No effect
Note:  The same rules that excessive drained below apply to Spectral Shroud.  All drain and stun from this ability heals immediately if the creature leaves the shroud.

resistance.value: all 11 (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

immunity.value: death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, precision, unconscious;
